file_content.text: [This holoterminal is offline.]
Master Satele, this is Carrick Station reporting. What's the situation on Cademimu?
Better than we hoped, thanks to you. Governor Chornarov was captured, and his separatist allies are surrendering to our forces.
Considering all the elite guards I had to fight, I'd expect the number of prisoners to be low.
There can't be many left.
I'm sorry you were forced to commit such violence, but your efforts saved lives.
We won't have to worry about further violence. That's good for everyone.
I'm glad the fighting is over.
The people of that world have suffered enough--and you spared them from more.
Do the Republic a favor. Skip the expensive show trial. We know they're guilty.
Lock them up for good.
That decision is not mine to make, but take heart.
Lock up that politician and his lackeys extra tight. People that slimy slip out of cages real easy.
Make sure no one escapes.
A maximum security prison frigate is already on its way.
That war criminal you wanted brought in made the mistake of trying to stop us. General Ortol won't be hurting anyone else.
General Ortol is dead.
I'd have preferred putting him on trial, but at least he didn't escape.
The Republic needs to make an example of the governor and those separatists. We don't want other worlds getting ideas.
Execute them.
Mercy encourages loyalty more than the threat of death. Do not let talk of revenge spoil our victory.
Not only did you liberate Cademimu, you thwarted an Imperial invasion. We detected an enemy fleet dropping out of hyperspace at the system's edge.
When the Imperials saw we commanded Cademimu's missile defenses, they retreated. Had they captured that world, dozens of systems would've been threatened.
Maybe the governor planned to join the Empire?
They might have been invited.
Chornarov would never have turned over power, but it's possible his separatist friends had other plans.
Never heard of the Empire running from a fight before.
Our enemy ran away?
They couldn't risk the attack. They knew what our missile batteries would do to their vessels.
It will be some time before Cademimu's government is restored. Until then, we'll maintain the peace.
I'm tired of talking.
Enjoy your respite from the fighting. I'll be in touch. May the Force be with you.
[This holoterminal is offline.]
This is Carrick Station on Emergency Response Corps priority frequency. Master Satele, do you read us?
Excellent--you've arrived just in time. The people of Cademimu are being held hostage by a criminal despot.
Governor Chornarov was under investigation for corruption. He was about to be arrested by Republic officials when he declared his planet's independence.
What crimes was the governor being accused of?
Sounds like he's guilty.
Extortion, blackmail and fraud are the least of his offenses. His government abused its power thoroughly.
Politicians usually need the voters on their side for something like that.
And the people agreed to that?
The governor enacted emergency powers and imposed martial law. The people of Cademimu have no say in this.
That's certainly a creative solution. If his world is beyond Republic law, he's safe.
It's one way to evade arrest.
If nothing else, it settles the matter of his guilt.
Chornarov was able to seize power because of the Republic's missile arrays stored on his world--and the criminal army he's amassed.
After separatist forces were crushed on Ord Mantell, Governor Chornarov secretly offered their leaders and surviving troops asylum on Cademimu.
Darth Angral had a secret listening post on Ord Mantell. I got to see the civil war there up close.
I've met the separatists.
Then you know what separatists are capable of. Unfortunately, they aren't our only concern.
Forgive my ignorance, Master, but I'm unfamiliar with Ord Mantell's political situation.
Tell me about the separatists.
Ord Mantell is fighting a civil war against violent separatists funded and trained by the Empire. But that isn't our primary concern.
Havoc Squad had a mission to wipe out those separatists. I intend to see it through.
My orders are clear.
Before we can deal with separatists, we must clear a path to the surface.
Separatists. I've hated those guys ever since I landed on Ord Mantell.
That filthy scum.
From what I understand, they're no fan of yours, either. But we have larger problems to deal with.
He's been smuggling separatists onto his world for months? How did we not notice that?
How did he manage that?
We did notice. We simply underestimated the number he brought in. Separatists were the least of our concerns.
The governor conspired with enemies of the Republic. He signed his own death warrant.
All traitors must die.
This mission is not about revenge. We have larger concerns.
The missiles produced on Cademimu are supposed to supply planetary defense batteries along the Celanon Spur, a major trade route. Those worlds now lie vulnerable.
Governor Chornarov has commandeered enough Republic planetary-level weapons that a large-scale invasion is impossible. The missile arrays would destroy our capital ships in orbit.
A lone strike team could slip past those planetary defenses. That's why we're here.
A small ship could get inside.
We have no way to remotely shut down those missiles? That's just bad design.
There isn't any fail-safe?
There were deactivation codes, but the governor's slicers disabled them. He'd clearly been planning this for some time.
That one man could bring the Republic to its knees is inexcusable. The SIS should've assassinated Chornarov before it got this far.
We should've killed Chornarov.
Killing elected officials is the Empire's way, not ours. We'll assign blame later. Our only focus should be ending this.
I need you to restore the planet's defenses to Republic control. That will mean defeating Governor Chornarov's elite separatist guards.
A stealth-equipped assault shuttle is standing by. Your landing zone will be Cademimu's capital industrial sector, close to the missile arrays.
We're on our way.
Is there a secondary target?
Don't make things too easy.
There is one last detail. Governor Chornarov is merely a corrupt politician. His private army's leader, General Ortol, is a mass-murderer.
Ortol sent thousands of innocent Ord Mantellians to their deaths. If you encounter that war criminal, bring him to justice.
Hurry to Cademimu before the remaining missile defenses come online and our window of opportunity closes. May the Force be with you.
[Start Veteran Mode]
[This holoterminal is offline.]
[Start Master Mode]
